an6.32:4.1: Then, late at night, a beautiful god, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha,
an6.32:5.1: “Sir, these six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.
an6.32:5.3: Respect for the Teacher, for the teaching, for the Saṅgha, for the training, for diligence, and for hospitality.
an6.32:5.4: These six things don’t lead to the decline of a mendicant.”
an6.32:5.7: Then that god, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
an6.32:6.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened.
an6.32:7.1: “Respect for the Teacher and the teaching,
an6.32:7.2: and keen respect for the Saṅgha;
an6.32:7.6: and has drawn near to extinguishment.”
